The Peter's 4-day suppressive test [ 13] was used, with thirty-six (36) mice (female and male) of average weight 20 g infected by intraperitoneal inoculations of 5 x 10 7 P. berghei infected erythrocytes per milliliter. The first three groups of 6 mice each were administered 125, 250 and 500 mg/kg. The positive and negative controls were Chloroquine (5 mg/kg) and 10% hypromelose, respectively. The 6 th group was non-infected and non-treated and was considered as the neutral control group. These products were administered daily, orally, during 4 consecutive days, to infected mice.
